title: Concept-Based Interdisciplinary Social Studies and Authentic Assessment Project

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic social concepts, experience in simple project execution
context.additional_context: Establishing collaborative learning environments using digital devices (tablets/laptops), with small-group activities to strengthen teacher-student interactions

learning_goals: Students can create a concept map analyzing community issues by linking three or more academic disciplines (social studies, science, mathematics).
Learners can collaborate with peers to complete a project report (approximately 5 pages) that meets actual evaluation criteria.
Students can record their learning process applying metacognitive strategies using a self-assessment checklist and peer evaluation rubric.

resources: Concept-based interdisciplinary design guide for instructors

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
